input_text:
Job Title: Administrative Accounting Specialist

Location: Phoenix, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Posting Date

04/18/24

Application Deadline

04/24/24

Pay Range

Pay Range: $19.15 - $27.50 hourly

Salary offers are based on the candidate's equivalent experience and internal equity with other employees within the same job classification. This position is eligible for overtime compensation for all hours worked over 40 in

the designated workweek.

Job Type

Unclassified

Department

Clerk of the Superior Court

About The Position

Are you looking to begin your financial career? Start with an organization that believes you can achieve it if you dream it!

The Administrative Accounting Specialist assists the Clerk of the Superior Court in disbursing court-ordered fees and providing account receivables to the public, the legal community, Courts, County, and other governmental agencies so they can be assured that all Superior Court monies are properly receipted, accounted for, and disbursed.

About Us

Join a team on a mission to provide fair and equitable access to justice. Our department is looking for people who strive to provide excellent customer service, collaborate in a team atmosphere, and serve the community. Every member is vital in providing services for the justice system, the legal community, and the general public. We are people making a difference.

Come make a positive impact as a member of the Maricopa County Clerk of the Superior Court.

Proud to Offer

Perform work with a greater purposeOpportunities for growth and development within Maricopa CountyExceptional work-life balance, flexible work schedule after trainingLow-cost, high-value healthcare for you and your qualifying dependentsEnrollment in Arizona State Retirement SystemPaid vacation, sick, and parental (birth/adoption) leavesExtensive wellness program, including healthcare premium discountsEmployee discounts for goods and servicesClick here for more information: https://www.maricopa.gov/5284/Why-Work-Here

We Require

Two years of experience performing clerical accounting, bookkeeping, or specialized administrative duties. Proficiency with spreadsheets, emails, and word processing softwareHigh school diploma or GED

We Also Value

Three or more years of experience performing accounting or bookkeeping functions. Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel)Associate’s degree or higher in Business, Accounting, or a closely related field

Job Contributions

Assist the accountant staff by disbursing funds from three major bank accounts, acting upon financial orders of the court, and recording and disbursing monies receivedVerify and audit department cashier deposits and prepares daily bank depositsMonitor and maintain the security of the cash vaultTrain new staff members and conduct ongoing training for subordinate staff in disbursement and account receivablesReceive, release, manage, and receipt funds in Trust in an automated systemReceive and download electronic data to check printing software and monitors the check printing processPrepare end-of-month agency checks for amounts receipted to various and multiple county funds throughout the monthProcess Court Orders from a workflow systemPerform research related to unclaimed and undeliverable funds and prepare and maintain fund listings for transfer to the Arizona Department of RevenueResponds to internal and external customer inquiries and requests with the highest level of service possible

Working Conditions

Mostly office setting in high volume, fast-paced environmentRequires long periods of sitting while completing computer activitiesAbility to carry, push, or pull 20-pound items up to a distance of 25 feetAbility to travel to and from job-related locations during a scheduled workday, subject to County policies regarding the use of County vehicles and/or private vehicles use on County businessSelected candidates must successfully complete and pass a criminal background check

Selection Procedure

Only the most qualified candidates will be consideredConsideration will only be given to candidates who submit online applicationsCandidates will be contacted primarily through email and their Workday online application profileMust pass a pre-employment background and/or fingerprint investigation as required by statute or policy, including drug and alcohol testing requirements for positions designated as safety-sensitive

Selection Procedure

Only the most qualified candidates will be consideredConsideration will only be given to candidates who submit online applicationsCandidates will be contacted primarily through email and their Workday online application profileMust pass a pre-employment background and/or fingerprint investigation as required by statute or policy, including drug and alcohol testing requirements for positions designated as safety-sensitive

Maricopa County is an equal opportunity employer.

Apply Now!

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

Acting upon financial orders of the court
Verifying and auditing department cashier deposits
Monitoring and maintaining the security of the cash vault
Conducting ongoing training for subordinate staff
Receiving, releasing, managing, and receipting funds in Trust in an automated system
Receiving and downloading electronic data to check printing software
Processing Court Orders from a workflow system
Performing research related to unclaimed and undeliverable funds
Preparing and maintaining fund listings for transfer
Responding to internal and external customer inquiries
output_json.physical_requirements: Mostly office setting in high volume, fast-paced environment. Requires long periods of sitting while completing computer activities. Ability to carry, push, or pull 20-pound items up to a distance of 25 feet. Ability to travel to and from job-related locations during a scheduled workday, subject to County policies regarding the use of County vehicles and/or private vehicles use on County business.
benefits: Perform work with a greater purpose
Opportunities for growth and development within Maricopa County
Exceptional work-life balance, flexible work schedule after training
Low-cost, high-value healthcare for you and your qualifying dependents
Enrollment in Arizona State Retirement System
Paid vacation, sick, and parental (birth/adoption) leaves
Extensive wellness program, including healthcare premium discounts
Employee discounts for goods and services

Our department is looking for people who strive to provide excellent customer service, collaborate in a team atmosphere, and serve the community. Every member is vital in providing services for the justice system, the legal community, and the general public. We are people making a difference.
